title: Deploy the application as a live/public build (fix invalid domain slug)

requirements.text: Fix the production deployment configuration to use a valid domain slug (5–50 characters; only lowercase/uppercase letters, numbers, and hyphens; no colons or other symbols) instead of the invalid slug 'public-applicant-onboarding-flow:-internet-identit', and deploy the app as a live/public build.

quotes: Domain public-applicant-onboarding-flow:-internet-identit must be between 5 and 50 characters and contain only letters, numbers, and hyphens.

acceptanceCriteria: A valid domain slug is configured that satisfies: length 5–50 and characters limited to letters, numbers, and hyphens (no ':' characters).
A production/live deployment completes successfully without the previous domain validation error.
The deployed app is publicly accessible and loads the expected login page at the root route ('/'), then supports the existing end-to-end flow after login (Details -> Upload -> Confirmation).

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other paths listed as immutable by the system context.
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor (no additional canisters/services).
nonGoals: Adding new application features or changing the existing onboarding flow behavior beyond what is required to achieve a successful live deployment.
Introducing third-party services (custom auth providers, external databases, hosting providers) outside the Internet Computer deployment model.
